{{also|知其不可而为}}
==Chinese==
{{zh-forms|s=知其不可而为|type=11211}}

===Etymology===
* {{RQ:Confucius}} ([[:zh:s:論語#憲問第十四|論語／憲問第十四]])
*: [[子路]][[宿]][[於]][[石門]]。[[晨門]][[曰]]：「[[奚自]]？」[[子路]][[曰]]：「[[自]][[孔]][[氏]]。」[[曰]]：「[[是]]'''知其不可而為'''[[之]][[者]][[與]]？」
*:: ''[[w:Disciples_of_Confucius#Zi-lu|Zilu]] spent the night at Shimen. (In the morning) the gatekeeper asked him, "Where do you come from?" [[w:Disciples_of_Confucius#Zi-lu|Zilu]] said, "I come from (the house of) [[Confucius|Mr. Kong]]." (The gate keeper) responded, "Is he (not) the one who '''knows the futility''' (of doing something) '''yet does it anyway'''."<ref>Mr. Kong ([[Confucius]]) was advocating morality during a time of chaos (a futile undertaking).</ref>

===Pronunciation===
{{zh-pron
|m=zhī qí 不kě ér wéi
|cat=id
}}

===Idiom===
{{zh-idiom}}

# to ([[stubbornly]]) do [[something]] even though you know it is [[impossible]]; to understand the difficulty of a feat but to attempt it anyway because it is the right thing to do (e.g. strive to eliminate world hunger)

====Synonyms====
* {{zh-l|知其不可而為之}}
* {{zh-l|知其不可為而為之}}
